newsitem.title: COTE D'IVOIRE: Togo raises 1996/97 farmgate quality cocoa price.
newsitem.headline: Togo raises 1996/97 farmgate quality cocoa price.

text.p: Togo's 1996/97 cocoa marketing season opened on October 24 with top grade cocoa farmgate prices up 10 CFA francs to 460 CFA and other grade prices unchanged, an official statement said on Thursday.
Grade one and two cocoa prices were set the same as in 1995/96 at 140 CFA and 120 CFA per kg, said the statement published in the official daily, Togo-Presse.
Asked about the size of the 1995/96 crop, the head of Togo's OPAT state marketing agency told Reuters by telephone, "Complete figures will not be available for at least one or two months,"
The new season would close on June 30, 1997. -- Matthew Bunce, Abidjan newsroom +225 21 90 90
